content:
Can you write a MATLAB code that can shuffle and display the ingredients of a sandwich in random order every time it is run? Use the following ingredients:
- Sliced bread
- Mayonnaise
- Lettuce
- Tomato
- Cheese
- Meat
Remember, the meat should be placed between the sliced bread, and the lettuce and tomato should go on top of the meat. The mayonnaise and cheese can go anywhere you like! Good luck with your sandwich making!

Certainly! Below is a MATLAB code that accomplishes the task of shuffling and displaying the ingredients of a sandwich with the specified constraints:

```matlab
function randomSandwich()
    % Define the fixed and flexible ingredients
    fixedIngredients = {'Sliced bread', 'Lettuce', 'Tomato', 'Meat'};
    flexibleIngredients = {'Mayonnaise', 'Cheese'};
    
    % Shuffle the flexible ingredients
    shuffledFlexible = flexibleIngredients(randperm(length(flexibleIngredients)));
    
    % Assemble the sandwich with the constraints
    % Meat should be between the sliced bread
    % Lettuce and Tomato should go on top of the meat
    sandwich = {
        fixedIngredients{1}, ...  % Bottom bread
        shuffledFlexible{1}, ...  % Random flexible ingredient
        fixedIngredients{4}, ...  % Meat
        fixedIngredients{2}, ...  % Lettuce
        fixedIngredients{3}, ...  % Tomato
        shuffledFlexible{2}, ...  % Random flexible ingredient
        fixedIngredients{1} ...   % Top bread
    };
    
    % Display the sandwich
    disp('Your random sandwich order is:')
    for i = 1:length(sandwich)
        disp(sandwich{i})
    end
end
```

To use this code, simply call the `randomSandwich` function in MATLAB. Each time you run it, the mayonnaise and cheese will be placed in a random order within the constraints provided. Enjoy your randomly ordered sandwich!
